COMMENT_TX: Opening Day at the Polo Grounds saw much ceremony as NY's 1924 pennant was hoisted, and tribute was paid to the Eddie Grant Memorial, with Hughie Jennings and Dave Bancroft laying the wreath, and the crowd giving a minute of silence Supreme Court Justice Robert F. Wagner threw out first pitch
NYT: Burrus handled the bunt as if it was going to bite him
Remarkable play: great running catch; fine throw.
NYT: Drag bunt; beat throw with head-first slide into 1B NYEW: swinging bunt
Giants tried for a 643/GDP but all hands were safe
Lindstrom knocked down the liner; Jackson pounced on the loose ball and threw Padgett out at 1B. NY Times claimed it caromed off the 3B bag, not Jackson.
Wilson lost it in the sun
Bancroft was trapped but made it back to 3B where Marriott had advanced.
Lucky hit when Kelly tried to avoid a pitch
Jackson tossed to Frisch who tried to catch Harris rounding 1B but threw over Kelly (again).
For the first few innings the drizzling rain almost hid the players from view.  Skies cleared up around the 3rd.
Harris whipped the ball home promptly
Graham somersaulted on the slippery field in a commendable effort to field it.
High over Wilson; he scored with a head-first slide

Sensational leaping catch but his throw to 1B bounded off Marriott's shoulder and past Kelly.  Frisch claimed Marriott had deliberately interfered with the throw but could not get any of the umpires to agree with him.
Marriott was tagged as he dove back to 2B
Fine pickup but threw wide to 1B

Wilson made a commendable effort to get to it, but he was running so hard that when he reached the ball after it had dropped, he kicked it yards ahead of him to the wall. Wilson & Frisch argued with Ump Sweeney that it was foul, then appealed to Ump O'Day who upheld Sweeney's decision. The protest lasted several minutes.
Scott pulled up between 1B & 2B expecting the Texas Leaguer to be caught by Fonseca.
Fine burst of speed & head-first slide by Frisch beat pretty throw home.
High fly fell in front of the tumbling Harper
Skipped through Meusel's legs to the fence
Neither Frisch nor Jackson made a move to cover 2B
NYEW: Past Fonseca;  NYTEM: skimmed a hit through SS
Frisch dropped the hot line drive but threw him out
Off Couch's left knee; he fell over in the box
Devine heaved over Frisch to deep CF trying to catch Fonseca
Fine running 1-handed catch close to stands near NY1 bench
DWS: no CS on error in 1925
Mitchell tried for the force at 2B
High throw; leaping catch by Kelly
Spinning bouncer that Lindstrom couldn't gather promptly

Mueller tried to force his way past Snyder at the plate and for a moment it seemed the players might come to blows, but there was such disparity among the players involved that the mixup excited a general laugh in which Snyder and Mueller joined.
Great running shoestring catch of low drive; he curled up like a cruller after making the grab.
Kelly knocked down the liner and stepped on 1B.  Hafey was trapped and run down.
Hit in the back on a slow ball
Close play called safe by Ump McCormick
Walker made a good try for it but it struck the concrete wall and bounded far over toward CF.
Roush tried a diving catch and insisted he caught it, but Ump Quigley ruled against him.
Hit upper tier of the LF stands PDT: Into lower deck of LF stands
Both runners were trapped but Bressler made it back to 1B
Game held up for a few minutes while Caveney had a speck of dirt removed from his left eye in the dugout.
Hit the facade of the upper tier in LF
High bounder glanced off Biemiller's glove
Caveney made the catch with his back to the infield.  It was revealed later that Frisch broke a metacarpal bone of the third finger on his right hand sliding into home.
Remarkable job, grabbing the ball by his ear
Fine running catch; robbed of hit
Alexander threw only 6 pitches in the 4th inning

Into lower tier far down where the stand turns into CF; one of the longest HRs here this season. HR came after Terry had fouled off two bunt attempts. Henry Fabian and Eddie Brannick measured the HR at 462 feet a few days later.
Into lower RF stands, close to foul line
NYT claimed the pitch nicked Kaufmann on his pitching hand as he grounded out.
Kaufmann injured his hand in the previous inning and was unable to control the ball. CDT reported his right thumb was swollen.
Fine catch close to the stands
During this AB Hartnett came within a few feet of a HR down LF line
Nice catch close to the stands
Youngs up-ended Adams at 2B preventing DP
Into lower RF stands, close to the foul line
Infield hit; high bounder over/off Keen's glove
NYT: So close to LF wall that Griffith couldn't grasp it
Jackson threw high to Barnes covering 1B on DP try
Barnhart misjudged or lost it in the sun
Cuyler claimed he was hit by the first pitch to him
Brilliant catch No SF; Youngs held 3B but scored when throw home got away from Smith on the short hop.
Running, head-first diving catch; he then jumped up and held the runners.
Stole while McQuillan made ready to pitch
Hit off the front of the LF roof
Came in fast; his throw home bounded over Smith but was backed up prettily by Aldridge.
Fine 1-handed catch; robbed of extra-base hit
Sensational assist on high bounder off Dean's glove; close play at 1B.
Southworth was running on the pitch and Smith made an unnecessary throw low past 2B.
Caromed off Dean's leg into RF past Terry
Cuyler tried hard for a 1-handed catch of the high fly
High bounder seemed to go through Grantham's glove
Running catch; very close play at home.  Head-first slide by Youngs.
$wild pitch bounce to Pirate bench, allowing Youngs to score from first

NYEW/NYT: Off the front of the upper LF stands PGT: 'High fly to LF hit the middle section of the stands for one of those terrible homers.  It was such a fluky thing that very few fans applauded the hit.'
McGraw directed NY1 from dugout for first time since 5/4
Vance was painfully injured on his left knee; time called
Low liner caught at his shoe tops
Long slide by Fournier beat the throw home
Fly fell between Wheat and Ford
McQuillan fell but threw him out from a sitting position
Taylor threw to Ehrhardt who threw wild to 2B when Frisch stayed at 3B. Official totals have no Meusel CS and both with SBs.
Fine running catch of high foul
Meusel played the carom perfectly, holding it to a single
Brown ran a long way for it
Fine play NYEW coverage ended here
Wide throw hopped past Frisch; no one backed up 3B
Terry made a great stop of Kelly's wide throw to 1B (DP try)
Beautiful throw home nipped Brown by a whisper
Into lower RF stands, his final career MLB HR. NYT described the HR as 'hilarious'.
Impossible stop/lightning throw by Frisch; Terry made a great 1-handed catch of the high throw.
Off Cooney's glove; Marriott recovered but threw past 1B
Frisch went into 2B feet first to protect his hands. Bancroft argued Ump McCormick's call.
Off Barnes' gloved hand, injuring a finger
During this AB, Wilson just missed a HR down RF line
Into upper tier of LF wing of stands, just inside foul line
Hit against upper tier of RF stands
Running catch caught close to the grandstand
Infield hit; high bounder over Aldridge
Traynor's throw to Grantham was in time to get Wilson but Hack slid under the tag.
Fine pickup NYTEM coverage ended here
Earlier in the AB, Moore just missed another HR down LF line
Fine play by Frisch and Terry; Pie was out by inches

Youngs, Ump O'Day, and Smith jockeyed about the plate after Youngs had taken two balls.  Pep stepped out of the box when Aldridge hesitated on the mound.  Then O'Day stepped out and began to dust off the plate.  Smith also moved out to make it unanimous.

With a 2-2 count on Kelly, Aldridge and Smith had a conference.  Aldridge then tried to break a curve over the outside corner that Ump O'Day called a ball.  Aldridge and Smith were vigorous in their protests; Smith had quite a rumpus with O'Day; Kelly drove the next pitch into the LF stands about 10 feet foul.  He then was called out on a fine curve.  There were many cheers for Aldridge.
Remarkable throw from deep RF by Cuyler to Traynor on the fly
Hit over Carey; low relay throw home went past Smith
Cuyler held it to a single
Youngs caught Barnhart napping and stretched the single
Low liner NYEW coverage ended here
Close play at home.  Earlier in this AB, Moore's fly to LF looked like a hit but just fell foul.
Moore collided with Snyder and knocked the ball loose
Spectacular assist; scooped & threw in one motion, nipping Jackson on a close play.
After pitching ball 2 to Frisch, Sheehan collapsed, falling to the ground with a wrenched left side; he was taken out.
Frisch took Lindstrom's throw to 1B but missed the bag
Little fly hit the upper LF tier just inside the foul pole
Easy high fly fell between Wilson and Youngs; heads-up base running by Grantham.
Hot liner caromed off Frisch's glove into CF; he recovered and threw to 3B.
As Barnhart slid into 3B, Frisch tagged him out
Jackson threw to Kelly who wasn't within 6' of bag; no error
ej,gowdh101,P,pfirc901,Balls and strikes (Threw glove) Gowdy ejected by Ump Pfirman for throwing his glove to the ground after a called third ball.
DP ball but Moore dropped the toss
Jackson collided with Moore at 2B after being forced
1-handed stop of vicious smash, whirled, and threw home
Frisch tried to catch the Pirates napping; rounded 3B but was trapped between 3B and home.
Hit top of upper LF stands
Marnaville covered 2B on hit & run as ball went through SS
Runners were moving on the pitch
Southworth was bothered by a Charley horse
Caromed off the concrete wall and skipped past Heathcote
Lindstrom stabbed at it, deflecting it to SS
NYT: the famous basket catch didn't work this time
Attempted double steal; Youngs scored during rundown
Frisch was trapped, but Hartnett ran him back too far before throwing too low to Freigau.
Jackson intentionally dropped the popup but the runners did not try to advance (Infield Fly rule).
Spectacular diving catch, though it appeared that he trapped it.  Ump Hart ruled a catch and the Cardinals protested.
Into upper stands in deep LF
Through Jackson, his lame leg twisted trying to stop it
Blades pulled up with a bad leg after rounding 2B and was carried off the field.
Great running catch close to grandstand
Wingo tried to score after Frisch overthrew 1B
The throw pulled Holke off the bag but the slow-footed Snyder couldn't beat it out.  Fans hooted.
Youngs collided with the RF fence
Liner handcuffed Lindstrom; off his glove
Walker played it off the wall poorly
Meusel let a couple of fancy curves go by then nailed one off the end of his bat.
Brown's drive handcuffed Lindstrom; off his glove
Easy DP but Terry failed to squeeze Kelly's perfect toss
Tall fly fell between Kelly & Youngs
NY Times reported Bentley batted right-handed initially, a strategic move by McGraw to block the catcher's view on the ensuing double steal.
Brilliant catch; nearly fell into a box
Caromed off Vance's glove back almost to the plate
Though badly shaken by the terrific drive, Vance managed to block it and make the play.
Lindstrom beat Leach in a dash to 3B
DWS: no CS on error in 1925
High throw over Frisch and into LF
Nice stop of high bounder, but threw high over Wrightstone
Friberg raced over but couldn't field it cleanly
Youngs tried to catch it close to the rug but it got by him
Attempted double steal; Southworth was run down.
Griffith's throw hopped wide of the mark
NYEW: Pittinger attempted to score on a pitch in the dirt CDN/CDT: short passed ball Maranville argued close decision with Ump Pfirman
Record attendance at Polo Grounds. More than 10K fans were turned away at the gates.  It was estimated that 30K in all tried in vain to see both games. It was standing room only, both tiers.
Rawlings received an ovation as he approached plate
Against upper tier of RCF grandstand
Rawlings juggled it but made a quick recovery
High bounder over Meadows; Wright caught it back of the box and tossed underhanded to Rawlings.
Low/wide throw; NYT reported it hit Bigbee's arm
Great try but the ball skidded off Frisch's glove
Cuyler beat throw to 1B by inches
Caught in front of Giant dugout
Skipped past Rawlings who made a splendid attempt at it
Rap knocked Frisch down and rolled into LF
Fine play on high bounder Rawlings had failed twice to SH
Smashed off Scott's glove to Frisch who tagged Rawlings
Bigbee was playing in the right spot, holding him to single
Speared high bounder with one hand
Barnhart let it roll by him
Lindstrom rounded 1B too far and was caught returning
Snyder stood in the box thinking it was foul
Through the hole vacated by Wright on hit & run
Grantham threw home; Ump Quigley called Jackson out but then reversed himself when the ball trickled away from Gooch. Southworth was credited with a hit.
The crowd gave Stuffy a big hand
Moore tried to bunt for a hit but credited with SH
Jackson fell as he tried to grab it for a play on Kremer
Infield hit; topped it on the grass

Frisch and Jackson moved to get under the pop; seeing 3B uncovered, Cuyler ran up the line about 25' as Jackson made the catch.  Jackson cocked his arm as if to throw to the plate, but when Cuyler came to a stop, he held the ball. Kiki lit out again for home, and despite Jackson's perfect throw, slid safely by a close margin.
Wild toss past Donohue, but no error

ej,donop102,P,quige901,Fighting ej,younr101,P,quige901,Fighting After getting hit on the elbow, Youngs started for the pitcher.  Pinelli and Hargrave got between them and Ump Quigley carried Youngs off to the side lines in his arms. Quigley ejected Donohue and Youngs.
Travis Jackson pulled up lame after first game which caused a Giant line-up scramble. Jack Bentley's 1st ever non-pitcher position (starting RF)
Lindstrom's hand was spiked making the play on Critz
Hit & run; Roush sought to catch the Giants napping
Farrell rounded 1B and was doubled before he could get back
Spectacular catch of Farrell's high throw
Running, leaping catch close to the clubhouse
Remarkable leaping, 1-handed catch against LF wall
High bounder hopped out of Greenfield's glove
Wind carried it away from Jackson
When Frisch's throw to 1B was wide, May dashed for 2B
Over Kelly; hit the grandstand wall in RF
Attempted double steal; Holke was tagged before Roush scored
Low/wide throw '...that Terry couldn't have reached with a butterfly net'.
Blades muffed the fly and kicked the ball to the infield
Mueller and Hafey collided; they were badly shaken up and time was called for them.
Bentley collided with Hartley but hung on
1-handed catch, but then threw over Terry into the stands
First pitch foul tip broke Hartley's 3rd finger, right hand
Hafey was trapped between 3B and home; he got back but Bell had advanced to 3B and was tagged out.
Kelly's smash hit Bell in the head temporarily putting him out, but resumed play after being patched up.
Fine stop by Terry but threw wild to 2B trying for force
Into lower RF stands Fans swarmed on the field as Bentley trotted around the bases and mobbed him as he crossed the plate.
Great stop; knocked down the smash
Gem of a catch on high foul close to LF stands
Gautreau trapped the pop fly but got the force
Pulled it down with his back to the diamond
Terry ran in front of Kelly; no play at 1B
'Bentley left the game for no obvious reason'
Stock knocked it down then booted it into CF but recovered
Over Cox; stretched an apparent triple into a home run
